brief_summary.textblock: Cryo AF Global Registry a prospective, global, multi-center, observational Post-Market Registry

detailed_description.textblock: The Cryo AF Global Registry is a prospective, global, multi-center, observational post-market registry (PMR). The purpose of this study is to evaluate and describe clinical performance and safety data in a broad patient population treated with a commercially available Arctic Front™ Family of Cardiac Cryoablation Catheters (hereafter referred to as "Arctic Front™ Cardiac Cryoablation Catheter System"). The cryoballoon ablation(CBA) procedure will be performed according to routine hospital practice. The study is expected to have a 24 month enrollment period. The follow up period is intended to align with standard practice and subjects will be followed for a minimum of 12 months post-procedure.

primary_outcome.measure: Freedom from Atrial Fibrillation (AF) Recurrence at 12 Months
primary_outcome.description: Estimate the 12 month freedom from AF recurrence using the Arctic Front™ Cardiac Cryoablation Catheter System

primary_outcome.measure: Freedom from Atrial Arrhythmia at 12 Months
primary_outcome.description: Estimate the 12 month freedom from AF / Atrial Flutter (AFL)/ Atrial Tachycardia (AT) using the Arctic Front™ Cardiac Cryoablation Catheter System.

primary_outcome.measure: Freedom from Device / Procedure Related Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: Estimate device and procedure-related adverse events for cryoablation using the Arctic Front™ Cardiac Cryoablation Catheter System through 12 months.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects 18 years or older with a planned procedure using commercially available Arctic Front™ Cardiac Cryoablation Catheter.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject is ≥ 18 years of age or minimum age as required by local regulations
- Planned procedure using commercially available Arctic Front™ Cardiac Cryoablation Catheter
- Willing to comply with study requirements and give informed consent (defined as legally effective, documented confirmation of a subject's voluntary agreement to participate in this clinical study) or authorization per institution and geographical requirements
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject is enrolled in a concurrent study that has not been approved for concurrent enrollment by the global study manager
- Subject with exclusion criteria required by local law
